result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Serenity O Bradford

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Serenity O Bradford in court.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court for Serenity O Bradford.  Prosecuting attorney Mallory R Davis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

As to Count 2: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information. Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 29.
Review hearing scheduled for February 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.

Defendant Serenity O Bradford appeared by video.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Serenity O Bradford.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. Defense counsel requests a DPA hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Serenity O Bradford in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Andrew Golden, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JNB.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 08/05/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Serenity O Bradford in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/3/22 2 2p
